channel.title: Docker on Victor Rachieru
channel.description: Recent content in Docker on Victor Rachieru

item.title: Using both Docker and Virtualbox on Windows
item.description: Oracle VirtualBox is a free and open-source hypervisor for x86-64 computers currently being developed by the Oracle Corporation. Microsoft Hyper-V, codenamed Viridian and formerly known as Windows Server Virtualization, is a native hypervisor; it can create virtual machines on x86-64 systems running Windows. The two are not exactly the same kind of hypervisor but we won’t get into that now. It turns out that when Hyper-V is installed on your Windows box, the hypervisor is running all the time underneath the host OS.
